tier_1_determinative.five_or_more_persons_committing_dacoity: Eight to nine unknown persons were involved in the dacoity, fulfilling the requirement of five or more persons.

tier_2_material.property_stolen: A gold chain and cash amounting to Rs.40,000/- were stolen from the first informant and his friends.

tier_3_contextual.incident_location: The incident occurred at the tin shade of Balasaheb Shedge, situated behind Jijamata Temple, Jijamata Chowk, Talegaon Dabhade.

tier_4_procedural.case_title: Ashish Kailas Kamble vs. State of Maharashtra
tier_4_procedural.court_name: High Court of Judicature at Bombay
tier_4_procedural.sections_invoked: Sections 395, 323, and 506 of IPC; Section 3 read with Section 25 and Section 4 read with Section 27 of the Arms Act; Section 3(1)(ii) and Section 3(4) of the MCOC Act
tier_4_procedural.acts_and_sections: Indian Penal Code, 1860; Arms Act, 1959; Maharashtra Control of Organized Crime Act, 1999

residual_details.additional_facts: The case involves organized crime allegations with co-accused linked to a crime syndicate led by Rohit Gaikwad. The FIR was lodged with a delay, and the identity of the accused was contested as the witnesses failed to identify the applicant in a test identification parade. CCTV footage was used by the prosecution but was not supported by forensic analysis.
